string_table.string: Closed captions. Press the spacebar to toggle captions on and off.
Skip Navigation. Hit enter to return to the slide.

slidelink.displaytext: Section One Quiz: True or False
True or False? I can share my TAP card with my friends and family
True or False? I cannot eat my lunch in a bus, train or station.
True or False? Everyone will love my music, so I should play it loudly.
True or False? I must carry, not ride, my skates, skateboard or scooter while in a bus, train or station.
Select the correct ending. When taking my bike on a Metro bus, I should:
Select the correct ending. With my bike, I should:
Select the correct ending. A wheeled item can be:
Select the best ending. A very important thing to remember about bringing my bike is:
Click the best ending. Everyone can have a pleasant trip when:
Click the best ending. There are special seats and areas for:
Click the best ending. We should pay attention to the posted rules because:

slidetranscripts.slidetranscript: Metro Transit School

Welcome to the Metro Transit School.

When you use the Metro System, you are agreeing to abide by basic safety and courtesy rules detailed in Metro’s Customer Code of Conduct.

This tutorial will help you be a more informed rider on the Metro System.

To move to the next page, just select the arrow located in the lower-right corner of the screen. The arrow will display when the narration on a page is complete.

When you see the arrow, you can select it to continue.

Select the Back arrow to go back one screen at a time, as far back as the beginning of the section.

Once you have completed a quiz, you cannot return to that section.

This tutorial is both spoken and written. Use the Sound button to adjust the volume or turn it off.

The spoken information will always be displayed in the text box on the left.

You can follow along by reading the text box.

At the end of every section, you will take a short quiz.

Once you select the right answer you can move on to the next screen.

If you make an incorrect selection, you’ll see a message and you can try again.
Three sections will be presented to you with a short quiz at the end of each section. You must pass all three quizzes to receive a Metro Transit School Certificate.
Welcome to Section One: Rules of Conduct

You’ve probably already seen this sign or portions of it at Metro Rail stations or on Metro buses and trains. Breaking any of these rules may result in a violation notice, fines and/or an exclusion from the system.

When you use the Metro System, you must pay your fare each time you board a bus or train. Fare is valid for 2 hours in the same direction, but you must tap at each transfer.

You can pay cash for each bus boarding, or you can use a TAP card loaded with a 1-day pass, 7-day pass or 30-day pass to ride the bus or train. You can also load cash on your TAP card and the correct fare will automatically be deducted.
Fare enforcement officers may check your TAP card to ensure you have validated your fare at the fare validator.
When you pay your fare to use the Metro System, it is for your use only. Regular and reduced fare TAP cards may not be shared with anyone else. They are non-transferable.

Keep the Metro environment clean and healthy. Do not eat or drink in buses, trains or stations.

 

Crumbs and sticky drops or spills create an unhealthy environment and increase clean-up costs.
Dispose of food, drinks, cigarettes and gum in a proper trash container before you enter a bus or a train platform.
Placing chewed gum on Metro property is prohibited.
Everyone enjoys his or her own music, but others may not. Loud music interrupts safety announcements, other bus, train and station announcements, and conversations.
Loud noise, shouting and unruly behavior are not permitted.

Wheeled vehicles such as skates, skateboards, scooters and bikes may not be ridden in Metro buses, trains or stations.

 

Carry or walk with these items until you leave the Metro facility.

Keep Metro clean and pleasant for everyone.

 

Damaging Metro property is a serious offense. It’s against the law to intentionally damage or to put markings on Metro vehicles, signs or property.

Selling or asking for money is not allowed on the Metro system.

You cannot offer any goods or services for sale. You may not ask for donations or panhandle other riders.

Safety is our first priority.

 

Dangerous materials such as explosives, acids and flammable liquids are not permitted in buses, trains or stations.

 

No weapon of any kind is permitted on a Metro vehicle or property.

Now you are ready for the Section One quiz. We know you will do well!

Please read each statement and decide if it is True or False.

Select the correct response.

You may begin the quiz at any time.

Congratulations!

You have passed the Section One quiz.

One down, two to go!
Welcome to Section Two: Bikes and Large Items

When you’re traveling with bikes, strollers, luggage and other large items, special rules apply.

 

Metro Rail trains have designated areas for bikes and other large items, and Metro buses have racks in front for bikes.

 

Doors, aisles and stairways must remain clear so people can move through freely.

Metro Rail trains have designated areas for bikes and other large items.

Oversize items such as full size shopping carts cannot be transported on Metro vehicles.

 

Look for the train door with this decal. Take your large item through this door and into the designated open area. Exit through the same door.

 

While on board, you must stay with your large item.

Doors and aisles must be kept clear at all times for passengers to board or exit, and for emergencies.

 

Do not block any door or aisle with your bike or other carry-on item.

All Metro buses have racks for bikes at the front of the bus.

 

When placing your bike on a rack, stay near the curb. Stay away from traffic lanes. Stay in view of the bus operator.

 

Remember to take your bike with you. As you near your stop, tell the operator you have a bike to remove from the rack.

When you take a wheeled or large item through a train station, it is best moved between levels by elevator. Wheeled items include skates, skateboards, scooters, bikes, strollers and luggage, as well as wheeled mobility devices such as wheelchairs.

 

Wheeled items are welcome, but only strollers and wheelchairs may be used in Metro trains and stations. All other items must be carried or walked – no riding!

Now you are ready for the Section Two quiz. We know you will do well!

Please read each statement and select the correct ending for the statement.

You may begin the quiz at any time.

Congratulations!

You have passed the Section Two quiz.

Two down, one to go!
Welcome to Section Three: Courtesy

We all share Metro’s buses, trains and stations, and it is everyone’s responsibility to maintain a safe and respectful environment.

 

Everyone deserves to enjoy the ride.

When boarding a train, stand to the side and not in front of the doors. This will allow riders to get off the train and create open areas for those who need to board.

To speed boarding on buses, enter through the front and exit using the rear door. The exception is for older adults and riders with disabilities, who may exit using the front door.

On buses, let riders in wheelchairs board first, and exit last.

Metro buses and trains have designated seating and areas for older adults, people with disabilities, people who use wheelchairs, and for people with bikes, strollers, luggage and other large items. Use the designated seats and areas when you need them, or make them available for people who do.
When taking a seat on a bus or train, do not take up more than one seat by placing your feet, your bags, newspapers or any other items on an additional seat.
When traveling on the Metro System, you must be fully dressed. In other words, you must wear a top and pants or skirt. And you must wear shoes.
Obey all posted signs. The rules are for your safety and the safety of others. Breaking the rules may result in a violation notice, fines and/or exclusion from the system.

Now you are ready for the Section Three quiz. We know you will do well!

Please read each statement and select the best ending for the statement.

You may begin the quiz at any time.

Congratulations!

You have successfully passed all three quizzes. You are on your way to becoming an exemplary Metro rider!

You’re ready to print your certificate. Before you do, note the “violation number” shown in the upper right corner of your Notice of Violation. You’ll need to enter it exactly as written. When you’re ready, select the Next button to continue.
